# The `UnsignedDivisionByConstantInfo` Struct Reference

## Description {#details}

Magic data for optimising unsigned division by a constant.

## Public Static Functions

### get() {#a6a7ecd0f6bb250280a31e56173931e31}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>UnsignedDivisionByConstantInfo UnsignedDivisionByConstantInfo::get (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; D, unsigned LeadingZeros=0, bool AllowEvenDivisorOptimization=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Calculate the magic numbers required to implement an unsigned integer division by a constant as a sequence of multiplies, adds and shifts.

Requires that the divisor not be 0. Taken from &quot;Hacker&#39;s Delight&quot;, Henry S. Warren, Jr., chapter 10. LeadingZeros can be used to simplify the calculation if the upper bits of the divided value are known zero.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/divisionbyconstantinfo-h/#l00030">30</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/divisionbyconstantinfo-h">DivisionByConstantInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/divisionbyconstantinfo-cpp/#l00074">74</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/divisionbyconstantinfo-cpp">DivisionByConstantInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
